section.title: Can and could
section.sectiontitle: Use can/can't + verb to say something is possible or someone has the ability to do something.
section.sectiontitle2: Use could/couldn't + verb to say something was possible or someone had the ability in the past.
section.text3a: We could play in her garden.
section.text4a: She could speak French by the age of twelve.

section.title: Be able to
section.sectiontitle: Use will be able to to say something will be possible or someone will have the ability in the future.
section.text1a: I'll be able to drive to work when I get a car.
section.text2a: She won't be able to come to the meeting on Tuesday afternoon.
section.sectiontitle2: To show degrees of ability use expressions like not at all/not very well/quite well/very well.
